relation: Table I-3 was temporarily removed - The percent change and APC for 1950-2000 were incorrectly calculated: For incidence data, the yearly rates for 1950-1972 were age-adjusted using the 1970 standard million population, and the remaining years (1973-2000) were age-adjusted using the 2000 standard million population. The mortality trends were based on rates age-adjusted using the 2000 standard million population.
Figure XXII-2 corrected - Incorrect labels were used for the age groups specified in the graph. Ages <50 and Ages 50+ were changed to Ages <65 and Ages 65+ respectively.
Figure XV-4 corrected - Incorrect data was used.

7/30/2003: The calculation of the significance test in the Joinpoint Regression Program was corrected. This changed a few non-significant annual percent changes (APCs) to significant increases or decreases in CSR tables and figures. 9/4/2003: A second modification to the significance test in Joinpoint resulted in 2 tables and 1 figure reverting back to non-significant as published on 6/5/2003. [View Details]
Lifetime risk tables added (DevCan Software used for calculations)
Figure IV-7 corrected - Incidence data for whites and blacks were reversed.
Temporary removal of: Table I-3: Summary of Changes in Cancer Incidence and Mortality, 1950-2000 and 5-Year Relative Survival Rates, 1950-1999

Joinpoint tables and figures Tables: II-1, III-1, IV-1, IV-2, VI-1, VI-2, VIII-1, XV-2, XVIII-1 Figures: I-21, I-22, XVIII-1 On Tables II-1, III-1 and Figure I-21, three APC values were changed to significant (7/30/03 correction) but changed back to insignificant (9/4/03 correction), thus converting the significance testing back to the original values published 6/5/03. Details provides a full explanation of methods and the affected values.

Contents of the CSR Suggested Citation Revision History Contents of the CSR On this page: This is a past version of the SEER Cancer Statistics Review that includes statistics from 1975 through 2000. If you would like to view the most recent version of the CSR, please visit the CSR Home Page. SEER Cancer Statistics Review, 1975-2000 The information on this page is archived and provided for reference purposes only. Please go to the SEER homepage to access current information. Contact Us Fact Sheets & Brochures In the News Quality Improvement Research Activities SEER Registries Read Full Overview SEER is an authoritative source of information on cancer incidence and survival in the United States. SEER currently collects and publishes cancer incidence and survival data from population-based cancer registries covering approximately 28 percent of the U.S. population. Overview Our Registries and Research About SEER
